dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MAN takes delivery of the flowers and carries the through the rear of the store to the display area up fron We stay on the tulips as we hear the following conversati

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Wow. How do they do that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 2.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: It’s an accident. It means the flower developed a virus early in the bulb stage. The flaws create the unusual coloring.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Can you arrange something for me with those?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Of course. What kind of price range are you looking for? Now we SEE the customer: TESS.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Well, it’s for my parent’s anniversary. They don’t know I’m coming. I just want it to be beautiful. Can you just do whatever you think looks best?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: I’'1l need a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Take your time, please. And thank you. The Owner moves toward a corner of the store where the flowers are arranged. Tess walks around, looking at the r of the store. Tess looks out the window. A black sedan is pulling up at curb.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: That should be some surprise.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Which?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: For your parents.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. I hope so. One of the POWER TWINS gets out of the driver’s side door crosses in front of the car. Tess starts moving away from window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh. Fortieth

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay. I think I have an idea. Something classic. The Power Twin opens the rear passenger side door, TERRY BENEDICT. Tess turns away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Do you have a bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Straight back, on the left. It’s unisex.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Thank you. Tess scurries to the back.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: (to Tess, a caveat) It’s unisex! revealing Tess flies past the bathroom and heads for the back door. pushes through it and runs right into Power Twin No. 2.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 3 A nice place on the eastern seaboard. We hear the faint s of a phone ring.  “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny Ocean picks up the receiver, checks the caller ID. smiles and answers:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Miguel Diaz speaking. Almost immediately, his expression clouds. He looks at hi watch. DANNY (cont’d) Tess, Tess. It’s okay. You remember what we talked about, if this happened? All right. Call me in twenty-four hours on that number. He hangs up the phone and runs out of the house. He doesn take anything with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny runs out of the house and down the street, leaving car in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, floral arrangement in her lap, sits in the car with Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: The Baldwins.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: We had dinner with them three years ago. You talked about your parent’s anniversary. She says nothing. BENEDICT (cont’d) I’m getting married next month.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: So am I. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Well, I hope Danny is as good as he thinks he is. A bouquet toss in prison can get pretty ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny takes a safe deposit box out of a wall, He opens th box, revealing a CELL PHONE and some CASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny boards a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landscape hurtles by. We pan over to find Danny sitti next to the window. We continue to pan and find REUBEN TISHKOFF seated next to a group of male commuters.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: (over) I really think you’re being too sensitive. She’s crazy about you. I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REUBEN lies in a mud bath, his face covered with a dried exfoliating “mask” treatment. There is a cigar in one han and a cellphone in the other. His eyes are closed to the

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Joyce, she’s ninety-two. I’m all she has left. (beat) The wheelchair thing was an accident, she’s having some trouble with the joystick. I’1l adjust it. (beat) I told you, when her mouth hangs open like that, that means she’s happy. (beat) I am. When are you coming over? (beat) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 13 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 6.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REUBEN (cont'd) You're tired because you work too much. You don’t have to work all the time. Don’t you want to take a break? Those trays look so heavy. (beat) Of course. How could you ask that? (beat) Because when I heard you laugh, all my problems disappeared. A SHADOW crosses over Reuben’s face, and Reuben squints o one eye. There, with the sun like an aura behind his head TERRY BENEDICT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben is handed a bloody mary by the porter, who then continues on, bringing a glass of white wine to THE AMAZI YEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen swims a strong, steady freestyle. Pull back to reveal that he is swimming in a 9’ by 5’ “Endless Pool” in his 1 floor Shanghai apartment. A HAND MOVES INTO FRAME and turns off the water current. immediately slams into the end of his jacuzzi-sized pool. lifts his head out of the water to SEE the POWER TWINS standing “poolside.” He spits out a stream of invective, in Chinese. The Power Twins look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen sets his magazine down and heads for the bathroom, wh TURK and VIRGIL MALLOY are waiting in line.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: The opening doesn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Duh.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: She shouldn’t have the same dream as Franklin. He’s the antagonist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It was your idea.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: No it wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn’t mine. It couldn’t be; it’s too stupid.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Why do you do that? why do you have to get personal?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It’s not personal, it’s a fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIRGIL and TURK MALLOY, in GTX lycra yoga gear lead a cla 13 14 (mostly female) through the vinyassa. The studio is mirro on three sides.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: It’s personal. You don’t argue logically. You attack. (to the class) Bring the right foot back even with the left, buttocks raised high.... (to Virgil) ...you have to have reasons, to support your argument... (to the class) ...flattening the back so the body forms a triangle.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: I can’t listen to you anymore. It makes me physically sick. Turk looks to him, but also sees a GUY in the class stari at all of the women "raising their buttocks high”. He indicates this to Virgil, who goes over to the guy.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Relax the crown of the head toward the floor. Draw the hips away from the hands, len--gthening the spine. And press the heels toward the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Virgil steps on the guy’s back and leans down to whisper his ear.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: This a serious class. No pigs allowed. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Virge. Virgil stands up. Benedict and the Power Twins are standi right behind him. His expression changes as he sees them the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Malloys and Yen are still waiting for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: You're hallucinating.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever, OJ. Finally, the lock OPENS and RUSTY RYAN exits. We follow h to his seat, where he puts on a pair of headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of molten metal bubbling in a small iron cask, a jeweler’ cask. MOVE to REVEAL a GARAGE filled mostly with cars in state of restoration FIND RUSTY as he painstakingly works on a new piece that just BELOW FRAME. Whatever it is, it is clearly getting t him. He shakes his head; it’s not right. It’s just not go enough. Rusty glances at the digital thermometer attached the cask of molten metal. It reads: 736.18 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You are kidding me.  17 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 9. INT. RUSTY’S CAR -- DAY 17 Rusty glances in his rearview as he drives through the ci talking on his cell phone. He’s keeping an eye on a white Cadillac that seem to be following him.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: 736.18 degrees Fahrenheit, Felix. I watched it.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (TELEPHONE V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rusty. What do you want from me? Rusty turns a corner, then glances in his rearview again.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I want what I paid for.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: And that’s what I sent.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: No, Felix, no. I paid for pure. And if my workshop were on top of Mount Everest it would be pure. But I’m at sea level, Felix, and at sea level it should liquefy at 736.95. If it’s pure, that is. Which this isn’t. Rusty makes another turn. A few seconds later, the Cadill turns behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (TELEPHONE V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, I didn’t know you were going to liquefy it. Rusty pulls to a stop light. The Cadillac pulls up three behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something: When Christo calls his cotton supplier and asks for 100% cotton cloth, do you think his supplier sends him 98% cotton and 2% polyester and when that doesn’t work, says to Christo, “Well, you should have told me you were going to wrap the coast of Australia”? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 18 19 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 10.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Who's Christo? Rusty looks to the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Felix, you're in a shame spiral. Have your assistant lose my number. Rusty snaps his phone shut. RUSTY (cont'd) My god. Rusty looks into the rear view mirror and then slows the to a stop. He gets out of his car and slams the door shut He walks back to the Cadillac and knocks on the window. I rolls down electronically to reveal Benedict. RUSTY (contd) How long you gonna give us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty continues to listen to his headset. We pan over to FRANK CATTON seated opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penthouse apartment. It takes the entire floor and ha 360 degree view. Right now, all of the furniture inside o is being taken away by movers. Frank enters frame.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Four weeks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We stole that money fair and square. You bought people off to find me. You took advantage during an economic downturn, and made them say some shit they shouldn’t have said. It’s not fair, it’s not just, and it aint’ cool. A long beat. Benedict stares back at him. FRANK (cont'd) Did you hear what I just said? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 20. 21 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 11.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: I heard what you said, Frank. Did you hear what I said? Frank looks at Benedict and the Power Twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes us to Livingston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston performs a stand-up routine.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: How many people here tonight were stupid enough to have children? A few people raise their hands. LIVINGSTON (cont‘d) Wow. No, seriously, that’s great. I have a child. A daughter. She’s five. They get to you, right? Am I right? Like emotionally. I mean, sometimes she’1l turn to me with her little face and her little shiny eyes, and she'll say, "Daddy, please stop hitting me,” and it just breaks my heart.’ People aren’t sure what to make of this. LIVINGSTON (cont’d) I’m Livingston Dell. Thanks for listening. See you at ten. Livingston strides off stage as we see that he is at the Bellagio, in the lounge. Benedict and the Power Twins are waiting for him. Somehow he isn’t surprised. LIVINGSTON (cont’d) (to Benedict) I appreciate you letting me finish my run. You’ve been very patient.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: What can I say? You’re a funny guy.  22 23 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston takes us to Saul Bloom, reading the Racing For INT. THE WASPIEST IMAGINABLE MEN’S CLUB -- DAY 23 All dark wood and oriental rugs. MOVE across a row of oil paintings that flatter stodgy club members from the 1800s the present. Land on Saul, sitting in window light that mimics the aforementioned portraits.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: What it is about horses? I ask you. Is it the strength? The beauty? The fearlessness? The grace? Of course. But there’s something else. Something in the eyes. The person with him nods. SAUL (cont'd) Yes. When I look into a horse’s eyes, I can tell: This one’s a winner. A jacketed WAITER appears, holding a tray.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Bloom?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: There appears to be a problem with your card. The waiter tips the tray to reveal Saul’s credit card, wh has been CUT INTO TINY PIECES. Without missing a beat, he reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You take Visa?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: I was acting on instructions from your business manager.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: My business manager? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 24 25 26 27 28 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 13.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Mr. Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul leads us to Basher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher is putting the finishing touches on a song. A prod and engineer sit behind a huge mixing console. It’s good- Basher’s really got something going here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher is leaning over a thick legal document, and Benedi is leaning over him. The music has been turned off.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Look at it this way...Eugene....if the album goes platinum it’1l cover what you owe. And if the second one goes gold, that should cover the interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher takes us to Linus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus looking from the front seat to the back, talking to Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: I’m responsible for myself. I have my own life and my own plans. I've never asked for anything but a fair shake. We make a deal, I stick to the deal. He turns forward, thinking. Then after a beat, he turns b to Benedict. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 30 31 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 14.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LINUS (cont'd) I just need to be absolutely clear that we have an understanding: If you contact my father, I’1l kill myself, and you’1l never get the rest of your money. Benedict nods. Linus turns forward and exhales, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus takes us back to Danny. The train hurtles onward.

dialogues.speaker: ABSOLUTE BEDLAM 30
dialogues.text: Reuben, Yen, the Malloys, Frank, Livingston, Saul, Basher and Linus are all talking at once -- right at us. Right a Danny. And they are not happy. The group is in an abandoned WAREHOUSE somewhere near NYC Danny is overwhelmed, like a deer caught in the headlight He throws a desperate glance at Rusty, who’s looking out window serenely, letting Danny flounder.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER 31
dialogues.text: Total silence. Everyone just stares at Danny, waiting for answer.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How many can’t make the deadline? Everyone raises their hands except Reuben.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: (off their looks) So I’m smarter than those schmucks on Wall Street. Whose fault is that? Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How many think if they run, they’1l be found? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone raises their hands. Including Reuben. Danny gets walks over to Rusty. The rest of the guys shrug and begin talking amongst themselves. After a long beat. DANNY (cont’d) Well, the only other--

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We’re on the five o’clock.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Good. A beat. DANNY (cont’d) Where?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Amsterdam. Danny steps back.

dialogues.speaker: AMSTERDAM
dialogues.text: Danny’s tone draws everyone’s attention. Noticing this, D and Rusty move into a nearby dilapidated office doorway. The guys go back to talking, mostly about what they were doing when they were found. This rises steadily in volume until the din is obliterated by a LOUD VOICE: DANNY (cont'd) I’M TELLING YOU THIS IS A DEATH

dialogues.speaker: FINE, THEN STAY HERE
dialogues.text: The guys exchange glances. Danny walks over to them and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston hands his passport to a KLM AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Flight 144 to Amsterdam. JUMP CUT TO the agent handing Livingston his boarding pas

dialogues.speaker: KLM AGENT
dialogues.text: You're in seat 43J. Enjoy your flight.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Uh...there must be some mistake. I mean...unless...is your first class section in the back of the plane? The agent looks back at him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: KLM AGENT
dialogues.text: No. JUMP CUT TO the agent handing Linus his boarding pass: KLM AGENT (cont'd) 32E. CUT TO the agent handing Virgil and Turk their tickets. KLM AGENT (contd) 41C and D. JUMP CUT TO the agent handing Saul his boarding pass: KLM AGENT (cont'd) 55K.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Fifty-five K? There’s a fifty-five

dialogues.speaker: KLM AGENT
dialogues.text: We've increased capacity by employing advanced design technology.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You made the seats smaller. Can you just say that? You made the seats smaller. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 33 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 17.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT to show Frank:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: See, you're not hearing me. What I’m trying to tell you is the reservations agent made a mistake when she issued the ticket, because on the rare occasions that I fly commercially, I always book a first- class ticket with no restrictions-- The desk agent looks back at him skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: KLM AGENT
dialogues.text: She may have, air, but this is the only ticket available to you on this flight. I need you to step aside so I can take care of the next customer.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Now, listen: Don’t make me get black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands with his arm outstretched, shoes and belt of Two TSA officers run metal detecting wands over every inc his body. Three more guys pick through his luggage: they squeeze toothpaste from his Sensodyne tube, sniff his hai products, unroll his "“tighty-whitey” briefs.... PAN to REVEAL that Basher is getting the exact same treatment, right next to him. They exchange looks. REVERSE ANGLE: the rest of the group stands sipping iced lattes from Starbucks and watching the show. Reuben walks

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Reuben.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I wanted to wish you luck. And listen: I want to do something for you. Reuben hands Danny an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What’s this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 18.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Take it. Take it. This is the least I can do. I’ve got a friend who owns the Bellagio of Amsterdam and I’ve made reservations for all of you there. It’s all taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: That’s very touching, Reuben.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: It’s the least I could do. I love you guys. Enjoy. Yen says something in Chinese. REUBEN (cont'd) No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: Yen sits in First Class, playing an in-seat video. Virgil Turk kneel on either side, watching his progress.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Great anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you’ll have to go back to your seats now. Reluctantly, they do. We follow them back to coach, where they pass Linus, talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Ground level. First floor. Day one. Planning stages. (beat) Planning stages. We move on to find Livingston, who grabs Turk by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: How'd he get that seat?

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: What seat? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 19.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 34 Turk moves on, taking us past a sleeping Saul and landing Danny and Rusty, who watch a movie with fixed expressions reverse angle shows us that the video screen is twenty ro away--it is impossible to discern any detail at all. Rust takes his headphones off and exhales. Danny notices this does the same. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Call me an elitist asshole, call me a bourgeois clown, call me anything you want, but ‘economy’ is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know...it’s not that ba- The guy in front of Danny moves his seat back suddenly an spills Danny’s drink all over Danny’s lap. Linus approaches Danny and Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Hey. You guys have a minute?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Sure, Linus.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: What’s on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Well, I know this may not be the exact right time to bring this up, but I’ve been thinking about...well, about where I want to be in five years, career-wise, and I've decided I really want to be more than just a role-player. I really see myself as kind of an idea man, like you guys. I mean, I know you do your part and you're in the trenches with us and all, but it’s really your show, and like I said, five years from now, I want to be running my own show.... Danny and Rusty exchange a look...then look back at Linus Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY RUSTY
dialogues.text: Right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 20.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: So if there’s any opportunity for me to be involved in the, you know, planning stages of things, I would really appreciate it. I really feel like I’m ready for more responsibility and that I could really make a contribution. Rusty turns to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Are you thinking what I’m thinking?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: (to Linus) We're negotiating the terms with her tomorrow. You feel up to taking the lead?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: This isn’t some gag?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: No gag.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Wow. Yeah. That would be awesome.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Okay, then.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Man. I wasn’t sure if I should say anything. Now I’m glad I did.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: So are we.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We’re here to listen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 35 36 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 21.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks. Really. You won’t regret this. Linus leaves. Danny and Rusty put their headphones back o Now they look content. Basher and Frank watch Linus go.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Tom.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: He can be a Tom?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Anybody can be a Tom.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You gotta make your own opportunities. This ain’t a rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Tom. Saul chews his economy class trail mix.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Boy, you’re tough.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Stop calling me “boy”. Saul stops chewing. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shots of the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group makes their way down a damp cobblestone street. They stop in front of a window and look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 37 38 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 22.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They have stopped in front of a narrow townhouse that has been converted to a hotel. The sign says "Bellagio of Amsterdam.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single room with 12 bunks in it. Their noses are wrinkl up because the place stinks.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: How could he lie to us like that?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: The sign said ‘the Bellagio of Amsterdam’. Everyone looks at each other and turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Look, you guys no frills, no perks, run-and-gun, all that stuff, and I said no problem because I believed you were right that we shouldn’t go deeper into debt and spend money we don’t have. I mean, am I the only one who thinks this might actually be a good thing? That we could use a little humility? That maybe we were a little too pleased and impressed with ourselves after the Benedict job? Okay, I grant you that maybe this isn’t what we deserve, but maybe it’s what we need. We can do this. No, I take it back: We have to do this. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four black mercedes skid to a stop outside Amsterdam’s fi five-star hotel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 39 40 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 23.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone emerges with big smiles on their faces. Everyone except Linus. He scowls, yanks his bag back from the hote doorman who rushed over to take it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess enters and buys a phone card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess talks to Danny. Across the street, a BLACK SEDAN is parked.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: What are you doing in Amsterdam?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (PHONE V.O)
dialogues.text: Only what I have to do to get Benedict off our backs.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Be careful, Danny. Please.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: How’s work?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It’s the same. I’m distracted.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (TELEPHONE V.O.)
dialogues.text: I keep trying to figure out what I did wrong. How did he find us? Tess can’t bring herself to tell Danny the truth, that it entirely her fault.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Danny, don’t keep thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (TELEPHONE V.O.)
dialogues.text: I did something wrong. He should never have found us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 24.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’11 call you tomorrow. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny hangs up the phone and site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other rooms, the guys get themselves settled in. Each takes a step toward personalizing their suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty lead an obviously eager Linus towards a coffee house.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: She’1l try and use her looks to distract you. Don’t let her.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Be polite, but firm.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Don’t get soft on us. Don’t make too many concessions.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: I won't. Danny and Rusty nod. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN. 44
dialogues.text: Who is obviously a MAN IN DRAG. Linus looks to Danny and Rusty but they give him nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 25.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: The onset of summer is like a woman who owns too many shoes. She/He looks to Linus, who looks to Danny and Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (bailing Linus out) If animals were capable of flattery, the World Bank would be open until 8pm.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: When I was four years old, I saw my mother kill a spider with a tea cozy. Again, the Evelyn looks to Linus, who has nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: A doctor who specializes in skin diseases will dream that he has fallen asleep in front of the television. Later he will wake up in front of the television but not remember his dream. Evelyn nods and looks to Linus, as do Danny and Rusty. He furrows his brow, then speaks:

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: O let the sun beat down upon my face, stars to fill my dreams. I am a traveler of both time and space, to be where I have been. Danny and Rusty stare at Linus like he’s nuts, like he’s cracked. Evelyn's entire expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Your young friend has a great deal to learn about respect. She/He puts his/her drink down and walks to another part the establishment.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Linus...why don’t you wait outside. Rusty and Danny follow Evelyn and quietly console him/her  45 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus cools his heels. Danny and Rusty emerge from inside

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Is that your idea of making a contribution?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Her terms were scandalous. And we were lucky to get them after what you said.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: The deal was this close to being blown.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: “Deal?” What “deal?” Danny and Rusty just look at him. LINUS (cont'd) I know what you guys are doing. Danny and Rusty exhange looks. What? LINUS (cont'd) Look. That...person had too many cupcakes. They just keep staring at him. LINUS (cont'd) I was playing along.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: “Playing along!”

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You called her mother a whore.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: A really cheap one.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Guys, I’m not falling for this. I’m not.... But Danny and Rusty aren’t laughing. They look pissed. Seriously pissed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 46 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 27.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LINUS (cont'd) I mean... Danny and Rusty just look at him. Linus squirms. LINUS (cont'd) I called her mother a whore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty explain the job to the group.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s a privately owned home. But don’t let that fool you. It’s extremely well-protected. A photo of a four-story canal house is displayed on a fla screen connected to Livingston’s computer.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: What are we after?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: A document. A very old, very valuable document. A photo labeled “The Vanderspeigle Getuigschrift” is displayed on screen.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: A stock certificate.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: The first one ever issued, from the first corporation on the planet. The Dutch East India Trading Company. It’s the only one of it’s kind and it’s worth a boat-load.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: What’s our cut?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: 2.7 million after expenses. A beat. Turk seems confused... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 47 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 28.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Each?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Who negotiated this? Danny and Rusty look at Linus,

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: What do we know so far?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: There’s a dummy key pad by the front door. (points to a diagram) But the alarm is really controlled by the keypad in Mr. Vanderspeigle’s second floor office. Now, here’s good news: we already know the system’s master code. Evelyn gave it to us.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That’s not good news, that’s really good news.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: We just wait until he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...that’s the bad news.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: He doesn’t. Frank flinches. Doesn’t like what he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: He’s agoraphobic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots of their mark, Vanderspeigle, being an agoraphobic

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: So he’s never been out of his house? Ever? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 29.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not once since he moved in ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Doesn't this guy believe in fresh air?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cracks his windows at night...that’s about it. When Vanderspeigle cracks his window we see that locking fall into place to prevent the window from opening more t a few inches.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Can we tap into the system from the outside through the phone lines?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Negative. It’s a closed-loop system with two redundant servers locked into titanium cases in the guy’s bedroom. 47K We SEE the servers in Vanderspeigle’s bedroom. 47A

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Could we use a remote device to trigger the panel?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s hard-wired and shielded.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Guys, am I missing something here? We know his damn code, right? You're telling me with that much information we can’t find a way into this freak’s house? Frank flinches again. He seem to be reacting to the term “freak.”

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Can’t we just get a telephone repair truck...  “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 30.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...put the basket up and use a telescoping rod through the open window to tap out the guy’s code? Turk’s idea plays out as it is in his MIND’S EYE, until:

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The street in front of the house is blocked off to vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And it’s covered by five independently-wired surveillance cameras....

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Monitored 24-hours a day by a security company. We SEE the security arrangements they describe.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: God, this guy really is a freak.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Crazy freak. Frank reacts again to the term “freak.” It really bothers him. Danny notices.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just...don’t call the guy a freak, okay? Everyone turns and looks at Frank like he’s a freak. FRANK (cont'd) What? The entire room is staring at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 31.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRANK (cont'd) What?! I mean, am I the only one here who feels funny about stealing from a...a...handicapped guy? Danny looks to one side of the room...then the other.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. The rest of the room agrees. Matter closed. Everyone just turns back to what they’re doing. DANNY (cont’d) Okay, so we know what we can’t do... Frank stews. DANNY (cont’d) Time to think outside the box, guys. A beat. Everyone thinks. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Okay, here's something...I’ve got an idea...suppose we--

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Well, but how--

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: There’s a Goldmann Grid over the enitre surface. Linus looks at him. RUSTY (cont'd) Is that what you were thinking about? Linus nods.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (sudden idea) But.... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 32.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: --Well, that’s different. Especially if we-- Rusty makes a circular motion with his finger and then st it with his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: (quick aside to Linus) A Schuman Special. (then to Livingston) Livingston--

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I mean, I’d need a day to--

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You’1l have three. Basher?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: No worries.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Virgil, Turk. VIRGIL. Just gotta get the gear.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Sweden.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Yen? Yen says something in Chinese. RUSTY (cont'd) What, and give up show business? Saul--

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: I know, I know. I’1l be bored. You'll be fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 51 52 53 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 33.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Clock’s running. Everyone gets up and leaves. Within seconds, Linus is alo standing in the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: What’s a Schuman Special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston uses a mock up of the alarm panel as a visual

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: (to Basher) Your shot has to hit directly above the keypad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Basher rehearsing the shot. He can’t get a clear s of the target. In fact, he can’t see it. He turns to Saul

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Let me see the specs. Saul pulls a well-worn copy of the alarm system blueprint Basher goes to the height of the alarm keypad in the bedr It’s 4’ 10”.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: How tall is the surface of this roof?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: About 87 feet.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: How tall exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks at a diagram of the safe they’1l have to crac when they get inside Vanderspeigle’s house, the safe that contains the "Vanderspeigle Getuigschrift”. Everyone but Linus and Rusty are here. But then Rusty comes in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 34.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You're not going to believe this.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We don’t have line-of-sight.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We tried everywhere. Some places we're only three or four inches off...but...there’s no straight shot. Even with Basher. It’s literally impossible. Linus enters, out of breath. Seeing everyone, he goes to Danny and Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you guys for a second? They nod and allow Linus to pull them into the corner. Li looks over at the group and then turns to ‘them.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Listen, I’ve done a little research on the Schuman Special, and uh...we don’t have line of sight for the shot.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Jesus. This’1l kill us.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (to Linus) Listen: Don’t say anything. If you’re ever going to run your own crew, you’ve got to remember to never show weakness.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s like blood in the water for these guys. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 54 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: If they think you’re slipping, you won't even see it coming. Linus swallows.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: But hey--thanks. Linus nods and goes back to the group.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: (to Danny) I need some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty and Danny walk along the adjacent road.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: The Swinging Priest?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Not enough time.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Crazy Larry.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Too many variables.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Robinov’s Revenge?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Too many obstacles.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: The Soft Shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Not enough people.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Baker’s Dozen.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We'd need a woman.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hell in a Handbasket. 35. 53 54 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 36.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Can’t train the cat that quickly.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I can’t have my wife watch me hauled off in handcuffs again.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s always about you, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: This like running toward a cliff. Speaking of which, how’s Isabel?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You get the tattoo removed?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Given its location, my doctor advised against it. Rusty stops walking. Danny continues, then notices he is alone. He turns back to Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh. As Danny and Rusty enter the hotel, Rusty trips on the st

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nice. Rusty bends down to look at the step. He notices that one tile on the edge of the stop has lost some mortar. He tou the tile and watches the lip rise up and down, up and dow as though it’s cantilevered.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You want to do what? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 37.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REVERSE to REVEAL Rusty and Danny.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Tilt it. Raise it slightly.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: The whole house?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s only a few inches.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Then I’1l have line-of-sight.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We can’t tilt a whole house.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: They did it with the Leaning Tower of Pisa.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: It took three hundred guys two years to do that. You’re crazy. Nobody's ever done anything like this.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Not true. Palowski did it in ‘64 in Venice and ‘73 in Istanbul.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: And he only had a crew of six.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: There are thirty pylons. We cut them, insert the jacks, and crank.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: For nineteen hours. Here’s the order in which they have to be done.  56 57 58 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 38. EXT. VANDERSPEIGLE’S HOUSE -- NIGHT 56 It is pouring rain. From across the canal, we MOVE toward Vanderspeigle’s house, favoring a barge moored just out front. Then, instead of moving over the barge, we PUSH THROUGH its hull to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Frank and Livingston inside manning a series of industrial water pumps. They’re grimy and covered in swea Rain drips through the deck above them.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: So, Basher approached me about being on a crew.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Yesterday. Frank thinks about that. Yen pops his head out from a small tube and says somethin Chinese. Frank shrugs...doesn’t understand. Yen tries again.... Th time he enunciates very clearly and talks very loudly (li Americans do when foreigners don’t understand English). Frank nods, starts turning the handle of the water pump i the opposite direction. Yen climbs down out of the tube. Then he climbs back up the tube. He picks up a jack in th corner. Climbs back in the tube. INT. UNDER VANDERSPEIGLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 58 We FOLLOW him as he climbs through the tube and emerges underneath Vanderspeigle’s house, inside its foundation. The thirty pylons extend from the base of the house into into the swamp it sits atop of. There is little space between the swamp level and the house. Runoff from the ra outside drips everywhere. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FIND Danny and Rusty struggling to place a hand-cranked j into a freshly cut space in one of the timber pylons. The are covered in muck and grime

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: The good news is, after the first twelve hours, I stopped being able to smell anything.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Took a few more for me.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: This water was stagnant six hundred years ago. FIND the Malloys, thirty feet away, using a fancy underwa saw to cut a space in another pylon. Because the cutting taking place underwater it is extremely quiet.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: There’s no reason for him not to. He would go to the cops.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Okay, so he goes to the cops.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Then they arrest Dominique. TURK. Right.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Then we have no story.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: She steals the money from Mr. Mulroney. They turn to look at Linus, sawing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Why would she? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 40.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: To pay Franklin to keep quiet. Turk and Virgil think about that. Linus keeps sawing.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: That’s good. INT. APARTMENT ACROSS FROM VANDERSPEIGLE’S HOUSE -- NIGHT Basher and Saul sit in big cushiony chairs.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Counterfeiting? Me? (beat) I have to tell you, it’s not something I condone. It’s cheating.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: It is cheating.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: There’s no subtlety to it.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: It’s kind of embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: No one I know...

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: I can’t imagine anything like that. A long beat. Then each of them reach into their jackets a produce $20 bills. They exchange and examine the bills closely by eye. Satisfied, they trade them again and retu them to their coat pockets.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Bolivia.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Diego’s people?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 61 62 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Well. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: I told him about you.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: I’m too old. That’s dangerous. My stuff is cheap compared to that. It’s just me and my gal, you know. What you’re talking about is organized. But thanks, anyway.
59 60 Frank sits watching TV. Livingston enters with groceries.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Jay Leno called.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: When are you gonna stop with that tired “white people can’t be funny stuff”? It’s so old, Frank, really. Do you want some orange juice? I got the good kind. Just then they are interrupted by Danny’s voice on a walk talkie.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Augie One, this is Condor. UNDER VANDERSPEIGLE’S HOUSE Rusty turns to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Augie One; Go Condor.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We’re fully cranked here. Let’s go to phase two. Livingston and Frank look at each other. 61 62 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 63 64 65 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 42.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Bring that orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher sets up his gear again. This time, when he raises crossbow to check his shot, HE CAN SEE THE KEYPAD. Just barely. He steadies himself. Saul knows that he’s ready to take t shot. He speaks into a walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: This is Gatsby. We’re green here. Basher aims. The INSTANT he fires the shot we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MALE SECRETARY (HESS) rushes through Europol’s extraordinary Richard Meier-designed headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Europol Agent ISABEL LAHIRI gives a presentation to seven five of her colleagues. With her on stage are a couple of seated HIGHER-UP TYPES. She’s nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Let’s discuss, briefly and to begin, with the category of "thieves", as distinguished from the larger category of what might be termed “hardened” criminals. The highest level, “master thieves,” if you will, is a very small world. Between six and ten high-level crews are operating in Europe at any given time. Worldwide, no more than twenty. The most famous, Gaspar LeMarc, is either dead or retired, and the expectation is that no one will replace him. The good news is the trend is toward their extinction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 66 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 43.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The secretary enters the auditorium and walks toward the podium.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: For example: Anecdotal evidence suggest these people are personally insufferable. The Higher-Ups look at each other; what did she just say?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Their egos demand constant praise, and they embellish their exploits to anyone who will listen. They tell their own stories endlessly, provided of course, they are talking to a fellow thief or an intimate. Many in the audience are now looking to each other, wonde if this is appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Those who interact with them on a personal level are relegated to positions of total servitude, with no chance for growth or freedom. Their lives are treated as secondary. Many of them suffer from depression. It’s a crime for which there is no law, and yet causes untold damage. One of the Higher-Ups convinces the other to say somethin but by now Hess the Male Secretary has reached Isabel and interrupts her by whispering into her ear. She balances. ISABEL (cont'd) (amplified by the lectern mic)

dialogues.speaker: DAY 66
dialogues.text: Isabel and Hess walk briskly through the ultra-modern hallway. He briefs her as they walk in a hushed voice. Th something he says stops her in her tracks. Hess continues to explain something we can’t hear. Then h pulls out some PHOTOS. Isabel leafs through them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 69 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 44,

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: That’s impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel arrives and is greeted by PAUL, a lead detective working the Vanderspeigle theft for the Amsterdam police department.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. We can really use your help on this one. His partner looks over at Isabel, who is wearing a skirt pretty damn good shoes. The guy checks out her legs and l away.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I hope the scene hasn’t been contaminated. Isabel walks away. Moments later, she enters the house wi the lead detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as she’s inside she’s all business.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No forced entry.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Not that we can find. UPSTAIRS -- VANDERSPEIGLE’S HOME OFFICE 69 Isabel looks around Vanderspeigle’s home office. Behind a fake bookcase is a small room which contains the safe. In the other direction is Vanderspeigle’s bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (nods ) We can’t figure out how they disabled the alarm. We thought maybe they tried to short it out somehow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 45.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, that would have triggered the system. Isabel goes to the alarm pad. Pulls the face plate off, examines She moves Isabel ex was locke closet. The lead Again, Is answering the inside. ISABEL (cont'd) And damaged the circuits.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: Well, then I don’t know how they got in.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: They had to have known the code. on to look in the mark’s BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (calls to her) We considered that, but the mark swears that nobody in the world knew the code except him. He programmed the last seven steps of the system himself. He set it and never left the house again. When he dies, we'll probably have to physically cut all the power lines to the house to get it off line. amines the computer brain of the alarm system which d inside a titanium case in Vanderspeigle’s bedroom She answers the detective almost as an afterthought.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: There are other ways to get the code. (to herself) Closed loop. Redundant servers. Titanium encasement. Not bad. detective enters the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Like what? abel is inside her own mind. She’s really just the detective’s questions out of courtesy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 46.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Uh...well, they probably set up in a house across the canal and watched him type the code in through a pair of binoculars. We GO WITH HIM as he walks back into the office. He stand at the alarm panel and pretends to type in the code. He twists around and looks out the window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (calling to Isabel in the bedroom) Actually, I don’t know about that. Isabel re-enters the office. PAUL (cont'd) Unless he had a habit of typing in the code like this-- He stands to the side of the panel and reaches over to ty in the numbers. It’s an obviously unnatural position. The he moves in front of the panel and types in the code as o normally would. PAUL (cont'd) --then his body would block the view from across the canal.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: That’s why they probably set up over there-- She points out an adjacent window on another wall. ISABEL (cont'd) --And used the mirror. She points at a small mirror on the opposite wall. The detective bends down so his eye is at the level of the keypad, then he looks in the mirror. He can see directly across the canal into another house. ISABEL (cont'd) I’m guessing they’d need a fifteen hundred millimeter lens to get a clear shot but-- But Isabel’s already moved on. Something has caught her attention just above the alarm panel: a patch of paint th is shinier than the paint that surrounds it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 70 71 72 73 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 47.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Isabel puts her finger to her tongue to wet it, then touc the shiny area. When she pulls her finger away there is paint on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel cocks her head. MIND’S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE 70 A black-clad thief (LINUS) uses a paint brush to touch up wall above the alarm keypad.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The lead detective watches Isabel intently.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What is it? Isabel uses the blunt end of a letter opener from Vanderspeigle’s desk to gently dig at the wall under the paint. The plaster there is soft and wet. In fact it isn’ plaster at all. It’s spackle. PAUL (cont'd) What is that? Isabel cooks her head again. MIND’S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE 72 THUNK! A crossbow bolt hits the wall above the alarm pane

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: It’s where the crossbow bolt hit.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: A crossbow bolt?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Ever heard of Franz Schuman?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 74 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Isabel is at the window. The one that Vanderspeigle leave cracked open every night. Isabel looks across the canal a the apartment where Basher and Saul were playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: They would have fired from that roof. Through this open window. Isabel kneels down, checks the line-of-sight to make sure she’s correct.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: From that roof, through this window? Nobody could make a shot like that.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Not a cop, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Sorry. Your friend downstairs put me in a bad mood.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He’s an idiot. You shouldn't let him bother you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes. You're right. Isabel pulls out a notepad and writes the name: “Eugene ‘Basher’ Tarr.” There are two names above Basher’s in her little book: “Robert Ryan” and “Danny Ocean.” ISABEL (cont'd) But these man are exceptionally good. Even when they make mistakes. MIND’S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE 74 A bolt flies through Vanderspeigle’s open window and hits wall above the alarm pad. Two thin wires are attached to tiny wheel, which is attached to the back of the bolt. Th wires run back to the window of the apartment across the canal. Inside that apartment: the wires end in another tiny whee which is mounted on a large tripod for stability. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 76 77 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 49,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In effect the group now has a mini-clothesline running between the alarm pad and the apartment across the canal. Livingston attaches a device designed to fit directly ove the number pad of Vanderspeigle’s keypad to the “clothesl that runs across the canal.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Isabel writes: “Livingston Dell?” Underneath Basher’s nam her notebook. MIND’S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE 76 Livingston's device is shuttled across the canal, through Vanderspeigle’s cracked window and right to the alarm pan Magnets on the side of the device cause it to snap into p over the top of the keypad. Livingston then types a six- digit code into a remote keypad. His keypunches are mimic by the remote device. Vanderspeigle’s alarm shuts off. Downstairs: From inside we see the front door lock picked The door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Isabel nods her head. There’s a slight smile on her face. The smile of admiration, respect in another’s skills.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: When did he get up and notice the certificate was gone?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The alarm woke him at 4:20 am.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: But the alarm would have been-- She stops. And smiles to herself. ISABEL (cont'd) Oh... Oh, I_know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What? Isabel quickly glances around the room. Her eye lands on floor near the false bookcase. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 78 79 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 50.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On some dark lines in the crevices where the floor boards meet. She kneels down for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: There was someone else.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Someone else. MIND’S EYE (ISABEL) -- THE NIGHT BEFORE 78 Danny and Rusty come through the front door. They are followed by Linus. All of them are soaking wet from 24 ho in the swamp under the house, and the last few minutes in pouring rain outside the front door. The group silently slips up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, I wish I could’ve have seen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter Vanderspeigle’s office. You can hear him snori in the other room. Danny and Rusty quickly, carefully rem the crossbow bolt from the wall and take it to the window They drop it (and the attached wires) to the Malloys, who waiting on the street below. Meanwhile Linus spackles the hole in the wall and paints the spackle. Danny and Rusty turn to see that Linus is finished. They hand-signal each other like Special Forces guys do, then towards the bookcase on the adjacent wall.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That must have really been something. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! Shhhh! Everyone freezes. Danny puts his hand up to his ear to tr to listen for the sound he thought he heard. We hear the faint sound of somebody singing to themselves. Danny and Rusty quickly realize it’s coming from behind t bookcase. What the hell? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 51.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 79 They yank open the false bookcase to reveal a handsome Frenchman who has just finished cleaning out the contents Vanderspeigle’s safe. Danny and Rusty stare at him. He turns around and sees them, but if he’s bothered in the slightest he sure isn’t showing it. Danny approaches him. This exchange is whispe with a great amount of drama at very close range. Just then, over.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: I am getting here first. Frank and Yen arrive. The Frenchman looks them

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: This is our score.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: I am here before you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (joining) We let you in the house! Somehow you got in after we hit the code but before we got to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: That’s thirty seconds. How could I know which exact thirty seconds I had? Unless I knew you plan. Could I have known your plan? Do you have a snitch in your group?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We don’t.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: Yes, I know you don’t. Because I saw, the whole thing from that chair. I knew you were around, but I had my own plan. Yen says something in Chinese. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: There’s really no need for that. 52. 79 Danny wants to raise his voice, but he can’t. Vanderspeig is snoring twenty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Listen, we have to come to some arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: We've incurred some very serious costs here. Danny and Rusty look at him.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Well, we have. The Malloys arrive.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: Every second I am becoming more outnumbered.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (whispering, re: Dinner Jacket) Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He said he got here first.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Hey. Mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: This is our goddamned job! He sounds as angry as a guy who’s whispering can

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: If the situation were reversed--

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: But the situation is not reversed. The situation is that I am here first, without any help from you. sound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 53.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Livingston arrives, soaking wet like everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: So as much as I would-- Basher and Saul arrive.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: Jesus, how many of you are there?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Just give us the stock certificate. Whatever else you took out of that safe...it’s yours. Dinner Jacket stops. Thinks for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: No. But: I leave you with something. He hands Danny a business card.

dialogues.speaker: DINNER JACKET
dialogues.text: My attorney. In case Evelyn's employer tries anything...well, anything. Dinner Jacket smiles, then pulls a tiny electronic device of his shirt pocket. He presses a button. And the alarm blares to life.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Paul stares at Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m sure there’s another scenario that would fit these physical details, but I don’t know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Where should we start? Isabel takes out her PDA, writes something on her keypad, hits a few buttons. A second later, Paul’s BEEPER goes of (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 54.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You can start by picking that guy up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group sits around looking depressed.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Who the hell was that guy?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s going to get out, you know. People are going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Somebody must know this bloke’s name.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: The question is who trained him. He got into that place alone.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: He says.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I believed him.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (unsettled) You think he’s better than us?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m not saying anything, but the man was sitting there, waiting for us.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Do you think the cops even know who this guys is?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Please. That guy’s never even seen a cop.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Maybe he works with the cops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 83 84 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You don’t work with the cops unless you absolutely have to. And not even then.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Either way, he’s got to have a name.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: It can’t be that hard to find out who this guy is. Like I said, somebody trained him. Who trains the best?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: LeMarc. (to Rusty) Right?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: If he’s not dead.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Who’s LeMarc? Stunned silence from the guys. They won’t even respond. Yen says something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel is waiting to be processed. Eventually, she is directed down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We LOOK through a one-way mirror into the interrogation 55. 81 82 83 84 room where detectives Onderdonk and Devenpeck are trying the b cop / bad cop routine on Evelyn. Isabel walks INTO FRAME and watches: Onderdonk slams his on the table. Davenpeck shouts in Evelyn's face. Evelyn just laughs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 56.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Isabel shakes her head. Frustrated and more exhausted than their detainee, the tw detectives leave the interrogation room for the ante-room where Isabel is.

dialogues.speaker: ONDERDONK
dialogues.text: Fucking stone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVENPECK
dialogues.text: I’m not quitting.

dialogues.speaker: ONDERDONK
dialogues.text: Who said quitting. I’m tired.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Can I speak to him? The two detectives look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVENPECK
dialogues.text: Who are you? Isabel produces a signed document. They look at it, shrug and give it back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVENPECK
dialogues.text: Apparently, you can do whatever you want with him.

dialogues.speaker: ONDERDONK
dialogues.text: Are you moving him?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh no. I just need to speak with him. To get some information.

dialogues.speaker: DAVENPECK
dialogues.text: We’ve been on him for six hours.

dialogues.speaker: ONDERDONK
dialogues.text: With our best stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DAVENPECK
dialogues.text: Our best stuff. In mind terms, we've been torturing this guy.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m sure. I only need a moment, then I’1l1 be out of your way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 57.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They shrug. Isabel goes into the room with Evelyn. We STA WITH Onderdonk and Davenpeck, who watch her through the t way mirror. THROUGH THE MIRROR: Isabel walks right up to Evelyn, smil and whispers one word to him/her. Evelyn's face freezes. He/she looks at Isabel, scared. Th he/she starts to weep. Uncontrollably.... Tears stream do his/her face. Isabel hands Evelyn a sheet of paper and he/she begins to write. Onderdonk and Davenpeck are dumbfounded. Isabel turns around so she’s facing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire group, minus Danny, sits around glumly watchin CNN International on the flat screen. Danny is on his cell phone on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: It’s not a problem, it’s a hiccup. It won't affect our schedule that much. I want to talk about you, not the job. How are you doing? KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK. Something about it doesn’t sound famil Danny moves into the big roam. Rusty is at the door, looking through the peep-hole. Rust puts his head down. Clearly it isn’t a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Tess, I’ve got to call you back. He hangs up. KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK. Rusty indicates for Danny get it.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Coming. Danny opens the door to reveal ISABEL. She looks at Danny He looks back at her. They don’t say a word. Danny motion for her to come in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 58.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: (still glued to the TV) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (to Rusty) Hello, Robert. Rusty spins to see Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Isabel. He crosses to her. STAY with the group for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: “Robert?” Is that his real name? Virgil and Turk shrug.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: How does she know that?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Ex-girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Fiancee.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY AND ISABEL 86
dialogues.text: The entire group is watching them.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s great to see you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Is it? Because you’ve been seeing a lot of me lately. She hands a surveillance photo to Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You were sitting in a Mercedes outside my apartment on Wednesday night. She hands Rusty another photo. (These are the photos Hess male secretary showed her at Europol HQ that we couldn’t see.) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 59.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You were hiding in the bushes when I had lunch yesterday at Trattoria Bella. She hands him a third photo. Looks at the fourth.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: This one...I’m not even sure where this one was taken, but I like ita lot. Very Ron Gallela. She hands this photo to Danny. It’s a picture of Rusty, w a dorky look on his face, peering out from behind a mailb he’s using as cover while he spies on Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I mean, if I didn’t know better I’d think you all came here to steal the Vanderspeigle Getuigschrift, also known as the world’s first stock certificate. (to the group as a whole) You must have been so proud of yourselves. A Schuman Special. It’s been awhile. (smiles at Basher) That was a very handsome crossbow shot, Eugene. Basher winces at the sound of his real name. The group stares back at her. Can’t believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: And the Palowski...whose idea was that? She knows it was Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We didn’t steal anything.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh...I know you didn’t. Somebody beat you to it. One man. No crew. No back up. Tell me something -- just so I can get the full picture in my head -- was he wearing a tuxedo? A white dinner jacket? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 60.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: (to Isabel) At least we saw him in the flesh. You'll never see this guy your whole life.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: So you know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Of course we know who he is.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Well, then. I’1l see you when you see him. To get your certificate back. She takes the photo of Rusty peeking from behind the mail from Danny’s hand. She walks out. The group is frozen. Livingston is still looking at the pictures of Rusty following Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: (to Rusty, re: the photo) Who's hat is that?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: How did she-- That was--

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (to Rusty) This is what I was talking about. This is exactly what I was talking--

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: --I was just checking up on her. I knew she didn’t want to see me. I was being polite.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Where did she learn all that stuff? The Palowski stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Her father.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: He was a cop?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Thief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Was he good?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: What’s the big deal? She’s just some brilliant, pissed-off ex- girlfriend who’s dad taught her every trick in the book.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Fiancee.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: But did you see that display of emotion, handing out those pictures?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Totally unprofessional.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: She's passionate.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: She’s unbalanced.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Her job is very stressful.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: She could reduce her stress by leaving us alone.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We’ve got to slow her down. Everyone agrees.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: But first: We find our French friend and introduce ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel is talking to her superior. She nods. ISABEL’S BOSS Twenty-four hours. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t have twenty-four hours. They’re there now. They’1ll lead me to him. ISABEL’S BOSS You also know that you can go now, if you don’t take your secretary. When there’s liability, I need a document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel exits.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: He said we can’t leave until tomorrow because of liability issues and he needs a document.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Thanks for trying.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Let’s share a car.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
