dialogues.text: That would be nice. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I can’t believe they won’t make an exception. (beat) I’ve got to find out who this other guy is.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 89 90 91 92 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner Jacket (AKA FRANCOIS TOULOUR) wins a huge blackjac bet. The crowd reacts enthusiastically. A beautiful woman stands near him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd around the blackjack table erupts as Toulour wi another massive bet. Note: The same dealer pays him off. The same crowd is watching. But Toulour is dressed ina different tuxedo, and a different women is standing by hi side.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He did his first big job in 1989. Bundesbank, Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The fifteen million dollar one the day the Berlin wall fell?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He was nineteen years old.

dialogues.speaker: INT./EXT. MONTE CARLO CASINO
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Toulour (in a different tuxedo, with a different beautiful woman) as he exits the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we PICK HIM UP on the exterior he is in another tuxe with another woman.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bank Faltier, Paris 190 and again in '91.... Total take twenty-one million euros. Bank of Italy ‘92. Eighteen million. Danish Treasury, also 192. Twenty-two million. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 93 94 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 64.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BASHER (V.O.) (cont'd) Prado museum. Madrid '93.... The Picasso. Estimated value--

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hang on a second! He-- All of them?!

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s not done.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wait -- Prado Museum, the Picasso -- that was Moretti.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONTE CARLO
dialogues.text: Toulour rockets his turbocharged Bentley into a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PICK HIM UP as he exits the tunnel in a new car, wearing new tux, with a new woman. Yen (in V.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He in Moretti. It’s one of his aliases.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: UDC bank in Geneva, ‘94. Nineteen million in bearer bonds. The Louvre --'95 and twice in ‘96. O.) says something in Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He left a Post-It note on the Mona Lisa that said “Bitch set me up.”

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tell them about Saint Tropez.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In 2000, he stole the King of Morocco’s 230 foot yacht. Vanished into thin air. Crew surfaced a few days later in a life raft. Couldn’t remember a thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How do you hide a two hundred foot yacht?!

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If the King knows, he’s not telling. He received it back a month later. 95 INTERCUT -- EXT. COTE D’AZURE -- NIGHT Toulour. Another car. Another tux. Another beautiful woman. He pilots his convertible Maserati at high speed along the windy road.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
dialogues.text: How far is your house, Baron?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes by helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One guy did all those jobs?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How'd he get all those aliases?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Until a month ago Interpol were convinced that the heists were the work of twelve different people. But not any more.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The French national police just gave him a nickname. “Le Renard Nuit” -- The Night Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Scotland Yard said he’s the new LeMarc.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Scotland Yard never saw LeMarc. 65. 94 95 96  97 98 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 66.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PRIVATE HELIPORT
dialogues.text: A helicopter lands on a massive Lake Como estate. Toulour gets out. New clothes. New woman.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Personal information?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Some say he’s one of these guys that thinks because he was born in a penthouse, he controls the elevator business. Others say he turned out okay when you consider how rich his parents were.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Taxes over here are brutal. People don’t realize.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Father was a big-time industrialist, got into the cellphone market on the ground floor. Mother inherited. Had maids as a child. He’s a public figure, people know who he is. He’s been rumored to run for office in Spain, even though he doesn’t appear to live there. INTERCUT -- EXT. / INT. TOULOUR’S HOUSE -- NIGHT 98 Toulour, in new clothes, with yet another woman, unlocks several locks and disarms two alarms. The woman can’t believe all the security he has.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
dialogues.text: What do you have in there, the Mona Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: (as if) Please.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
dialogues.text: (doesn’t miss a beat) You know what? I don’t like that painting either. I don’t like anything Van Gogh did. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 99 100 101 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 67.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Toulour smiles and lets her in.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s an avid golfer, pro-level tennis player, and inveterate gambler. But apparently his favorite pastime is.... Linus trails off.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Spit it out, Linus. INTERCUT -- INT. TOULOUR’S VILLA -- NIGHT 100 A tableau shot looking into the bedroom. ANOTHER BEAUTIFU WOMAN joins Toulour in his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: He’s rarely alone. I think it’s a compulsion. I have a list of names here...it was just the first week.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: All right, moving on, is there anything else we need to know about this guy before we--

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Did we forget to mention he’s a Viscount?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Viscount. As in nobility. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (cannot take it anymore) Last time I checked titles like that went out with a little number I like to call the French Revolution--

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Spain.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: His title. It’s Spanish. Mother's cousin. INTERCUT -- INT. TOULOUR’S BEDROOM -- DAWN 102 Toulour crawls out of bad. Wonders who the woman next to is.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: He may be the greatest thief in Europe. He may have slept with half of the EU. He may bea Casanova with the soul of a starving artist. It doesn’t matter. INTERCUT -- INT. TOULOUR’S HALLWAY -- DAWN 104 Toulour comes downstairs in his bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: There’s something he cares about. There’s something he can’t live without. INTERCUT -- INT. TOULOUR’S HOUSE -- DAWN 106 Toulour reaches the base of the stairs and stops dead in tracks. He looks ahead of him to a wall covered with paintings. One painting is clearly missing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: All that remains are the dust/fade marks on the wall to indicate that it had been there. He walks up to the wall and smiles -- certainly this will an interesting day. He’s actually been cheered up by this 107 EXT. TOULOUR’S VILLA -- DAY 107 Toulour in playing a hard-fought game of tennis. His opponent (EDMUND) bangs a great shot. Toulour gets there and smacks it back. Edmund dives for the ball, just gets it b over the net. But Toulour is waiting and hits

dialogues.speaker: EDMUNDS
dialogues.text: Are you on steroids? Toulour laughs.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Let’s try again. Give me five games this time.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: You are worse than Sampras. You should be paying me. A BUTLER arrives.

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: (in French) Pardon me, sir. He hands Toulour two business cards. One says Ocean,” the other “Rusty Ryan.”

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: (in French) Two gentlemen. They say they met you in Amsterdam last week.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: (in French) Put them on the veranda and get them a drink. I’11 be right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a kill shot. “Daniel 108 Danny and Rusty look out over Lake Como. Toulour arrives.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: (to Danny) Rusty. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TOULOUR (cont'd) (to Rusty) Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Other way around.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Usually I’m so good at that. Edmund arrives, carrying his tennis bag.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: This is Edmund. Edmund. Rusty. Danny. He calls by their wrong names again.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Edmund. (making conversation) You a tennis pro? Rusty takes a sip of ice tea.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Actually, no, I’m the King of Morocco. Danny and Rusty nod, their smiles frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toulour shows Danny and Rusty his art.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Sadly, I can’t show you my favorite painting of all -- a Degas that used to hang right there -- because it was stolen recently.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s awful.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: The criminal element is everywhere these days. Toulour nods.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Listen, Francois-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 110 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 71.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Please. Call me Baron.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We came here for the Vanderspeigle certificate--

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: That’s not for sale.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Your Degas is worth three times that. You want your painting back, you’re going to have to trade.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: You actually expect me to believe that you are in possession of my Degas? You are living in a...ina bubble. Toulour looks at them and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty and Danny stand with the rest of the group.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: He used the word “amateur”? Rusty and Danny nod reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: You said we could show him the painting right, to prove that we had it.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: He still wouldn't trade. Yen says something.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We need to teach him a lesson. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 72.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: All right, let’s stay calm. We don’t need to over-react here. He said some disrespectful things, that’s true. But why antagonize this guy? Why get into something with him? He’s young and he’s filthy rich, and he’s got time on his hands. We don’t want to become his Betty noir. We can just fence his painting and earn a lot more than we would have from the certificate.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: It’s about reputation. You said so yourself. We have to get that certificate to Evelyn’s buyer or--

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We'll make enough selling the Degas to pay off her buyer--

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Then why did you make that trip down there in the first place, if you didn’t want to get into something?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Saul?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Turn his name over to Isabel. In exchange for getting off our backs. Tough one to swallow.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Short of that...the only appropriate response is to steal his next job right out from under him. Just like he did to us.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: We don’t even know our next job.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We got ten million in that closet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 111 112 113 114 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Danny points at the closet in the room.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I cash in the Degas, take a moment to think about our next move. Toulour isn’t going anywhere. You guys are hyping him too much, you're letting him get inside your head. Everyone agrees. Danny opens the closet. There’s a picture frame in there, but NO PICTURE. It’s be stolen by Toulour. We hear the SOUND OF A CASE BEING SHUT AND LOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a SMALL, SECURE BOX being transported to a heavily secured truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck exits the building and drives down a street wit security MOTORCYCLES surrounding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcade heads for the private airport. The secure box is loaded onto a plane as Isabel and her m secretary Hess exit a plane nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel and Hess heading into Paris.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why do I need to see all these guys? When I tracked the Munch down in Sweden I got all the approvals I needed with one phone call. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 115 116 117 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 74.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ISABEL (cont'd) With Lenin’s shaving kit the Russians brought me in and it took a single signature and I got it at the airport a minute after I arrived. What’s so goddamned special about the French? Hess gives her a look as though she should know better.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Without their signatures, you can’t do anything. You can’t pull the suspects over, you can’t do surveillance on them, you’re not even allowed to contact them. They're real sticklers about sovereignty issues here. INT. PARIS BUREAUCRAT’S OFFICE -- DAY 115 The Bureaucrat looks at Isabel. All of her.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Isabel, I couldn’t possibly sign those documents in good conscience without talking to you about the case in detail. I realize you're in a hurry and my schedule for the rest of the day is quite full, so perhaps, if you’re interested in being expedient, we could discuss the case...over dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits in the back with Hess.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Foucquet’s at eight-thirty. Apparently their’s a private room. Better bring your kevlar. (to the driver) Don’t stop for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver accelerates through a yellow/red light, almost hitting DANNY AND TOULOUR Who deftly avoid getting crushed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 75.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s not how I want to go.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: No. They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Very theatrical of you...asking to meet here. Like we’re spies meeting to do an exchange.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to us?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: This is a game for you. For us it’s survival. Are you that bored? I mean...

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: No. I wouldn’t do that. No... The truth is...I made a bet. Or maybe a better word is a “wager”.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What kind of wager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Toulour sit across from each other. The bottom quarter of the Eifel tower is visible in the background.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: A gentlemen’s wager with a friend of mine -- my mentor. A few months ago we were at his winter place in Nicaragua and another guest referred to me as “the greatest thief in the world.” I didn’t object, obviously, but my mentor fell silent. Later I asked him about it. He said if I really wanted to say I was the best thief...I’d have to prove I was better than the eleven of you. (beat) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 119 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TOULOUR (cont'd) You know, the Benedict job made waves, even all the way over here. 16.3 million dollars. That’s a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Sorry. 163. Before you were found.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Yes, 163 million is a lot of money. It attracts attention. So, ina way, you brought this problem with me on yourselves. You're victims of your own success.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Here's what I’m going to do. You tell me the name of your mentor. I‘11 call him up and I’11 tell him that you’re the greatest thief in the world...that I accept that to be true.... And in return...you leave us alone, let us go about our business. How about that?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: He said you’d probably say something like that -- but he said you'd probably have your fingers crossed when you said it. Danny frowns, pulls his hand out of his pocket. TOULOUR (CONT’D) So in this situation -- for the purposes of my wager -- words aren’t good enough. I have to prove this on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: This mentor of yours...was he a good thief in his day?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Who, LeMarc? 76. 118 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 120 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 77.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Danny swallows.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on the group -- they’re slack-jawed.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Who? Yen says something.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I thought so too.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: LeMarc. The LeMarc. Danny nods.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: God hates me. He hates all of us.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hell, this could go on forever.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No. It’s going to be settled by one more job. A single object.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, let’s just let him have it.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We can’t.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Because of pride?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Because we beat him, he’1l pay Benedict off. A stunned beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (new lease on life) Now we're talking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 78.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: One score, for the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: What do we have to do? I mean, is it a fair bet or is it like...the Coronation Egg or something? Danny points. That’s it. That’s the one.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: He wants us to steal the Coronation Egg!

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: That's just... that’s...what is that?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: The Holy Grail.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Carl Faberge, the greatest goldsmith in history, constructed the Coronation Egg in 1896 for the wedding of Czar Nicholas and Alexandra. Every world class thief in the last 108 years has tried to steal it. No one has even come close.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: That’s because it’s cursed.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: It’s un-stealable.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s the only thing in LeMarc’s entire career that he went after but failed to get. He tried three times. A long beat of silence....

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We get the egg and we’re free. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 121 122 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: That’s great, except we can’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: It’s not possible.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Then we go to jail. A beat...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Well...where is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SMALL, SECURE BOX is being taken off a plane. 79. 120 121 Another motorcade forms and escorts the vehicle into the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcade is completely stopped in traffic. 122 In a nearby sedan, Isabel sits next to an Italian CARABIN LIAISON of same sort. Hess is in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m going to need surveillance on both hotels, phone taps, room bugs, people in the lobby and by every exit.

dialogues.speaker: CARABINIERI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: If I had to guess I’d say I’1l need at least 25 people, a dozen vehicles...and an on-call air unit.

dialogues.speaker: CARABINIERI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Okay, one more thing, and this is crucial: these guys are extremely, sophisticated at avoiding electronic surveillance, so we’1l need real state of the art stuff. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 122 123 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 80.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ISABEL (cont'd) I'm talking synthetic aperture pinhole cameras, wave reformation mics with a high Plank coefficient and a passive input structure-- You're not writing anything down; are you sure you’re getting all this?

dialogues.speaker: CARABINIERI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. Now what time am I meeting Captain Giordano? A beat...

dialogues.speaker: CARABINIERI OFFICER
dialogues.text: (tentative) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, what time? Another beat...

dialogues.speaker: CARABINIERI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes...absolutely... Isabel looks right at him.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I see...so...you’ve spoken with the Pope and he’s okay with autographing my breasts? Hess turns around.

dialogues.speaker: CARABINIERI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely. Isabel sighs loudly and sinks back into her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcade arrives at the Museum of Modern Art. We follow armored car and continue on to find Danny walki up the front steps.  “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on Livingston as he subtly nods at something in the distance. Danny is standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What am I looking at?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: A TR354 infra red motion detection system. It’s the gold standard.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Saul and Linus back yet?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: And I can’t find Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Yen look at an “authorized-entry only” door as member of the museum staff goes through it. The door has complex double-locking mechanism that would make it impossible to pick. Yen says something in Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What? Yen says something in Chinese, again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know, but that’s one nasty lock. Danny approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Seen Rusty?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We thought he was with you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 126 127 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Danny moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher is being questioned by Danny.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Not since we first got here. About an hour ago. Danny moves away. BASHER (cont'd) (to Danny’s back) And where’s Saul and Linus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel enters her room. Suddenly she spins and draws her pistol. Her gun ends up in Rusty's face.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Jesus, Robert. I could've killed you. He shrugs. A long beat as she takes a look at him.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I’m older.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I hope so. What are you doing in my room?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I thought maybe we could get some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Okay, how about a two week trip to Zanzibar?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Please don’t. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 83.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Fine, coffee then. Whatever you say. Isabel gives an exasperated sigh.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Why do I want to have coffee with you?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: How should I know? sorry about your mom. Isable nods. RUSTY (cont'd) She was a real...

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: She hated you.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Well, she was nice enough to hide it from me. Some people can’t even do that.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: She hated everybody. Rusty nods. He remembers.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You'll never get it by the way.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Get what?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You’1l think you’ve got it, you’ll be so close that you’ll be able to taste it and then this guy, the Night Fox or whoever he is, will just take it -- right out of your hand -- just like he did in Amsterdam. He’s as good as LeMarc.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s not possible.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You’re in a bubble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 129 130 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 84.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rusty looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mock up of the room the egg will be displayed in. A dum egg sits on a cradle in the center of the room. Infra-red motion detectors cover the room. Motion sensitive lasers shine directly onto the egg. Danny, Basher, Yen, Frank, and Livingston try to figure o how to get around the security systems.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON, (IN THE BACKGROUND)
dialogues.text: No, that won’t work either. The IR will pick it up before you even get close. This is depressing to everyone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Look, if we’re having this much trouble, and we’ve got ten guys Toulour must be pulling his hair out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. POOLSIDE
dialogues.text: Toulour lies in a lounge chair.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The group agrees Toulour must be suffering like them. Rusty strides in. Everyone looks at him. He looks at the up of the egg.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Would you call that bubble-shaped?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What? Rusty shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: She pulled a gun on me. He sits. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 130 131 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RUSTY (cont'd) She won’t back off.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Are you back on?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I’m selling. She ain’t buying.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: More importantly, what kind of reception is the Italian Police giving her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUBORDINATE OFFICER leads Isabel down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SUBORDINATE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Captain Giordano is handling an urgent interrogation. He’ll be up as soon as it is completed. Please wait in here. He leads Isabel and Hess into the Captain’s office. A lar clock on the wall reads 11:45 am. The open windows in the office look out onto one of Rome’ famous courtyards. Captain Giordano stands with three oth officers. They are having a loud, tense conversation in Italian. Isabel watches as Giordano’s temper really flares. He jab his finger at one of the other cops.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Naples sucks! They’re a joke! The only decent player they have is Pasqualli -- and he’s a pussy.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN COP 1, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Pasqualli runs circles around Bologna’s backfield every time.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN COP 2, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Pasqualli could single-handedly-- Isabel turns to the officer who escorted her in.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What are they talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 132 133 134 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 86.

dialogues.speaker: SUBORDINATE OFFICER
dialogues.text: It’s an internal matter, Madame. Isabel and Hess look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain continues to argue. Those involved in the discussion are being brought lunch. INT. CAPTAIN GIORDANO’S OFFICE -- DAY 133 Isabel’s sitting on the couch now, her eye lids drooping. Hess checks his PDA.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN COP 3, (0.S., SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: --and her friends could trounce Naples! The clock on the wall reads 2:20 PM. Isabel’s been here t and a half hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Livingston, Yen, Danny, and Rusty are experimenting with way for Yen to drop from the ceiling so that he’s hanging right over the egg. Their mock-up alarm rings. A red light flashes.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: Damn-it. Danny rubs his face. This is feeling impossible. He goes into the corner and clicks a walkie-talkie. in the background we see Rusty trying to keep everybody's spirits high.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: All right, okay. Let’s not be defeatists.... What about that mirror trick that Akimbo tried at the--

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: --There’s no mirror thin enough to avoid tripping the lasers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 87.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the foreground, Danny on the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing now?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL, (RADIO V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just reading the papers at acafe. Oh, no, wait. A woman just sat down next to him.... He’s getting her phone number.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (RADIO V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wow. What are those?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL, (RADIO V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jimmy Chu.

dialogues.speaker: TURK, (RADIO V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen that color.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (into walkie) Okay, take it easy over there. Saul and Linus enter.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What happened? Linus puts his BACKPACK down.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: We thought someone was following us.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: We gave ‘em the shake. Caught ‘em napping. 135 INT. CAPTAIN GIORDANO’S OFFICE -- DAY 135 Isabel is asleep on the couch. It’s 5:30 PM. A hand taps her shoulder. She wakes up and is shocked to see Captain Giordano, finally, standing above her.

dialogues.speaker: SUBORDINATE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (doing the introductions) Captain Giordano, Rome Police Special Investigations. Isabel Lahiri, Europol, Major Theft Task Force. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 135 136 137 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 88.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Captain nods. Isabel looks over at Hess, who is still asleep.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER 136
dialogues.text: Isabel and the Captain are alone now. Giordano is looking right into her eyes, with laser focus. There isn’t even a hint of lasciviousness about him. He’s all business.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: ...reason to believe these men... (lays out photos of Danny, Rusty, and Toulour) .«..are going to try to steal the Coronation Egg when it is actually put on display next week. I need official authorization to surveil and pursue these suspected criminals on Italian soil.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: And I’1l need substantial resources from your department. Can I count on that?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely. Isabel stops. Starts to wonder.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: So, Captain, what do you think of my skirt? He smiles and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: I think it’s very beautiful. Why, don’t you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Toulour. A waiter brings them coffee, Danny SPO in a lot of sugar, then stirs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 137 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 89.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: I don’t usually call for a second date. For you I make an exception.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: I think it’s good that we talk. You see, you should stop following me. You're wasting your time. I’m going to let you go first and get caught. Then they will increase the security even more, and then I will steal the Egg. Then Lemarc can make his decision.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You sound confident.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Confident? This is a very American word. I am arrogant. There’s a difference.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter if you’re that good. Are you that good?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: I can move objects with my mind. Danny just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: You don’t believe it?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Are you done stirring your sugar? Danny stops, lifts the spoon. It’s completely BENT.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s fantastic. (starts to go) Listen, I appreciate the call, and, best of luck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 90.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Danny. I’m serious. Sit down, please. Danny site down and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You're telekinetic, is that what you're telling me?

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Yes. But...it’s a curse. A nightmare. Everything is too easy. But then LeMarc says I’m still not the best. So I take his challenge. And you will fail, and I will win, and so what? What does it prove? What is he trying to show me? Danny just looks at him. 138 INT. CAPTAIN GIORDANO’S OFFICE -- DAY 138

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: Ms. Lahiri, you’re in Italy now. We are a sovereign nation. We're not some adjunct, some administrative district of the EU. When Europol calls we don’t jump up and tap dance for you. If you want to work in Italy, then you have to do it under Italian authority...and that means you have to talk to Commander Andriotti...who, I’m sure, will be happy to meet with you some time next week--

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Next week!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: --when he returns from vacation. Isabel slumps back into her chair. Stares up to the heave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel and Hess walk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 140 141 142 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 91.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: He said he has to get approval from someone else and they’re on sick leave.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Vacation.

dialogues.speaker: HESS
dialogues.text: Sorry I fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: We both did. I’m exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exasperated Isabel tries to regain her equilibrium wit cappuccino. A piece of music comes over the cafe loudspea that catches Isabel’s attention. A CHEESY WAVY SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL'S FLASHBACK 141
dialogues.text: Years ago. Isabel’s sitting at the very same cafe reading the newspaper when she hears frantic police whistles. She looks up to see a man running down the street at full bor As he gets closer we realize it’s Rusty. Eight cops are chasing him. Rusty rushes past the cafe. As he does he notices Isabel, they make eye contact. Then he’s gone. Sprints around the corner. The cops rush past her. She hears sirens convergi from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel shows her Europol identification to a detective.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Hi, this isn’t official business. Actually, I’m here on vacation. But I was sitting in a cafe this afternoon, near the Piazza Navona and...the police were chasing someone on foot. I was just wondering if you caught him or...do you know anything about that case? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 143 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 92.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: I know the case, yes. Unfortunately, we didn’t catch him.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits in the same seat the next day, reading the newspaper, enjoying her vacation. She looks up and stops cold. Rusty, all cleaned up now, dressed in a perfectly-tailore suit, sits down three tables away from her. She stares at him. Can’t believe it. The brazenness. The audacity of this guy. Rusty doesn’t seem to have a care i the world as he chats easily with the waiter, in Italian. Finally, Isabel just can’t help herself. She gets up and walks over to Rusty’s table.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Um...Did I...? I think I saw you...yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: The police were chasing you.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You sure your eyes aren’t broken?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m quite sure it was you.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Well, then I’m not gonna argue. Can I buy you a coffee?  144 145 146 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We transition back to the cafe. Isabel’s phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We've got to stop meeting like this. She turns. He’s sitting at the table behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel and Rusty are being quiet for the moment. The waiter’s in the midst of an animated discussion in Italian with one of the customers.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What are they talking about all the time?!

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Soccer. (translating) He doesn’t like Naples....thinks they’re a bunch of...sissies. (turns to Isabel) Can I ask you a question? (off Isabel’s nod) Will you come to Zanzibar with me on Friday?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sleeps, sitting up, in a chair as the rest of the g tries to figure out how to defeat the security systems ar their mock-up egg. The group breaks into applause startling Danny awake.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: We did it! It works! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 147 148 149 150 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 94.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT MEDIUM shot on uniformed National Police officer as strides down the hallway. His bearing is disciplined, ste formal. He is clearly handling a matter of utmost importance. Tilt down to reveal he is carrying a tiny cup CAPPUCCINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Police Officer blows through, passing Hess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel sits with Commander Andriotti. The office door swi open and the National Police officer walks in. He places cappuccino on Andriotti’s desk and leaves. INT. CAPTAIN GIORDANO’S OFFICE -- DAY 150 Giordano sits with his feet up on his desk, smoking a cig The door swings open and Isabel strides in, catching him completely off guard. She thrusts a piece of paper in his face.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: An order signed by Commander Andriotti instructing you to “provide any and all support that Agent Lahiri requests, whenever she requests it.” He looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: It’s good, yes. Okay. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: That’s a very nice blouse you wear today.  “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus and the Malloys walk through the museum.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: When Dominique goes back with Thomas to check the trunk, the money shouldn’t be in the briefcase. Franklin should have double-crossed them.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: That could be a great moment, when he’s on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: And you think Thomas is going to get blown up.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Hey. They look. A large group of Security people are talking t some NEW TECHNICIANS and ISABEL.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Another camera here and here. And have a guard here at all times so any attempt to disable the system will be detected. All your IR devices need to be fitted with reflective faces otherwise a UV later can be used to burn the sensors out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look glum.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: She just walked in there like Patton or something. She’s changing...everything and-- There were so many cops with her. I’ve never seen so-— Danny plats up his hand to stop him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152 153 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 96.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. If her father was a thief...why’s she such a hardass? I mean you'd think she'd have a little sympathy for us.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: When she was twelve her mother told her that her dad got arrested doing a job in Russia and died in jail. (beat) So I wouldn’t count on much sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: “This time it’s personal”. Danny looks to Rusty, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen police cars parked in front of it. Isabel stands at a police checkpoint on the road in front the museum chatting with Captain Giordano, who’s clearly brown-nosing her big-time since receiving Andriotti’s ord Her phone rings. She looks at the number and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ever heard of overkill?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t even think Toulour can get it now.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: If he gets it, we’ll let you arrest us. If we get it, you come away with me to Zanzibar--

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What is your obsession with Zanzibar?!

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Do you want to make the bet or not? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 154 155 156 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m hanging up. Stop calling me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel crosses to the elevators. INT. ISABEL’S HOTEL ROOM -- DAY She enters. Shuts the door behind her. Then, starts balling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Rusty stand with Livingston.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, with everything she’s done in the last twenty-four hours...unless you happen to be best friends with the head of security at the museum, unless you are someone he knows and trusts enough to leave alone in the gallery, after disabling about half of their security system, forget it. We are not stealing that egg...

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: “Someone he knows. Someone he trusts....” “Someone he knows....”

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: What about someone he doesn’t know but trusts?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: For instance?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I’m talking about you know who, who looks an awful lot like you know who... Everyone looks at Danny. 97. 153 154 155 instantly, 156 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She might. It’s not going to be easy getting her over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess walks down the street. She passes an alley, where a utilities truck is raising a MAN IN A BUCKET. She enters the department store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess shops for perfume. The Power twins watch her from a discreet distance. She smiles at them. Then makes her way to the ladies room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in and goes right for the window. She’s about t open it when it opens from outside. She jumps a mile unti she sees that BRUISER is there, standing in the bucket fr the utilities company.

dialogues.speaker: BRUISER
dialogues.text: Hiya, Tess. Just climb on through. Try not to look down too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four stories above an alleyway. Tess climbs out the ladie room window into the cherry picker basket, with Bruiser’s help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess climbs into a taxi cab. Reuben -- in an anachronisti taxi driver’s uniform -- is driving.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: There’s make-up in the bag there. And some photos. Do the best you can.  162 163 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOTEL MANAGER comes to the front desk to answer a cal

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
dialogues.text: Bonjourno. Yes. Yes. Oh...oh, really. Well, absolutely. We can have...I can make our presidential suite available. No, no, no. No trouble at all. We’d love... We’re honored that she’d think of us... He hangs up. Turns, elated, to his front desk staff.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Julia Roberts is coming to stay with us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, as Julia Roberts, steps out of a Mercedes limo wear sunglasses and carrying a puppy. Frank and Basher, as Nat of Islam bodyguards, clear a place in front of her. Reube trails, dressed in the latest hip-hop clothes. A throng of fans and paparazzi rush toward her. Strobes blind us. Fans scream out her name, thrust paper and pen her for autographs. It’s a frigging madhouse.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS
dialogues.text: Ms. Roberts! Ms. Roberts! Why did you come back to Rome so soon!!

dialogues.speaker: PRESS
dialogues.text: Was it to see Topher?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: To see what?

dialogues.speaker: PRESS
dialogues.text: Topher Grace!! Your co-star!! Is that why you’re here?!

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh. No. I came to -- to see the-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 163 164 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 100.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS
dialogues.text: Where’s Danny?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PRESS
dialogues.text: Danny, your husband!!

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (looks to Reuben) Well, he’s not really--

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Ms. Roberts is very tired!! Please let her through! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess enters and shuts the door behind her. She takes a de breath and exhales. She looks up at Danny, who’s there waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I can’t do this. Danny goes to her. Kisses her. Hugs her. When he steps back he answers:

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yes, you can.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m not an actress, Danny! And I don't look like her!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You do, Tess. You really do. I never told you that before, but it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Come on: my... She notions at her body, but we can’t tell what part.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: And my... She motions at her body again; again it’s totally ambiguo what part. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 101.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: And my ears. Anybody who sees my ears is going to know instantly.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nobody's looking at your ears.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Yes, Danny, they are. They’re going to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel stands with the MUSEUM DIRECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: When did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: MUSEUM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: We just found out. I arranged a private showing for tomorrow morning before we open the show to the public.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t understand, why do you have to disable any of the systems--

dialogues.speaker: MUSEUM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Because she might want to get close to the egg, got right up here and look at it. And I’m not going to embarrass myself or this institution by telling her she can’t.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: She’s an actress, Giovanni, not the Pope.

dialogues.speaker: MUSEUM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Do you realize how much free publicity we'll get for this museum, just because she because she decided to come by and look at the egg? She’s even agreed to do a photo shoot for us promoting the museum. Isabel gives an exasperated sigh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 165 166 167 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 102.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: That's exactly the sort of thing...

dialogues.speaker: INT. WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Saul, Frank, and Rusty sit on plush couches and watch Isabel's conversation with the museum director from six different angles. Clearly, Livingston has tapped into the museum’s closed circuit system.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL, (TELEVISION V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...that the people I’m after will exploit. (thinks ) Okay, fine. You want to shut down half the electronic system, let me post eight cops in the room... Saul, Frank, and Rusty clench teeth and fists... On pins needles for a moment. If the museum director agrees they' in big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: MUSEUM DIRECTOR, (TELEVISION V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? That’s worse than....you want me to treat her like a criminal? The guys relax back into the couches, their plan narrowly having escaped disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Saul, Frank, and Rusty relaxing. Only this angle has a digital quality to it -- because we are watching them now through a hi-def TV screen. PULL BACK to REVEAL Toulour, sitting in a warehouse of hi own, watching his own surveillance footage of both our qu warehouse and the museum’s closed circuit system.

dialogues.speaker: MUSEUM DIRECTOR, (TELEVISION V.O.)
dialogues.text: Look, if you need to do something to reinforce security during her visit, fine. But it’s got to be out of sight. And it can’t effect Julia in any way. Are we clear?  168 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toulour eats with a beautiful woman. Virgil sits six tabl away, keeping an eye on him. Turk strolls in and sits with his brother.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: (points at Toulour) There. I took a look at the interrogation scene.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: ‘Cause Linus said it was repetitive.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: It clarifies everything.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: He said it’s too on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: What’s he, the head of the studio? What’s he ever written?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: He’s just saying -- Oh, no--

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It’s not him! Turk spine to see “Toulour” get up at the other table. On it’s not Toulour. It’s somebody who looks like Toulour fr behind.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: What! How did you-- You moron! You said you were watching him the whole time! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 168 169 170 171 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 104.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: I was! I mean, I used the bathroom once, but it was quick. You lost him yesterday! They sit for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Livingston said Frank said that Rusty said that Danny said Toulour said don’t ever bother following him. INT. RUSTY’S HOTEL ROOM -- NIGHT 169 ON Rusty -- the blue light of an unseen television reflec off his face. He walks onto the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: WAVY TRANSITION TO FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: We follow Rusty down a hallway. He enters a dark apartmen Slips silently through the dining room. Two places are se A candle on the table is burned down to almost nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are out here too. But Isabel’s still awake. Rusty enters the room. She doesn’t look at him

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I have to go. Right now. I have to leave the country. It could be a while. A month. Maybe more. Isabel turns to look at Rusty. She can barely see the outline of his face in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What are you saying? What the hell are you saying? Where are you going? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 171 172 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 105.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you. Isabel stares at his dark face.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: When people start talking the way you’re talking there are only two possibilities: you’re either in intelligence or you’re a criminal. And no one I work with has ever worked with you...or even knows your name.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You knew what I was the day you met me, Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Robert...

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: We can talk about it when I get back.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: No, Robert. I have to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m taking the job. I’m moving to Amsterdam. He doesn’t respond for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I can’t have this conversation right now. Please, Isabel. I have to get out of here. I love you. He kisses her then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the front of the apartment, he shuts the door and turns toward us. We see his face in the light for the fir time: His left eye is swollen shut. Blood is caked into h hair and on his cheek. Somebody beat the shit out of him.  173 174 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 106.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE PRESENT DAY 173
dialogues.text: Rusty is still on the balcony. There's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty and knock at the door. He opens it to see Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You want to walk?

dialogues.speaker: -- NIGHT 174
dialogues.text: Isabel sit on the steps of the Campidoglio.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I know how you’re planning to do it. I know Julia’s visit is the key.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Who's Julia?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (after a beat) LeMarc knew when to get out. He just gquit...with his perfect record intact. Now he’s a legend. (exhorting) Don’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: LeMarc quit because he was 75 years old, Isabel. He was tired. His doctor told him if he didn’t start taking it easy he was going to have another heart attack. You’re dramatizing it.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You don’t know why LeMarc retired, any better than I do. You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Actually, I do. I know exactly why.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Really? How’s that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 174 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 107.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: He told me.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (skeptical as hell) You know LeMarc?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: For six months.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You-- She’s so mad she can hardly speak.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You knew LeMarc? You knew LeMarc and never told me? That’s the worst thing you’ve ever done to me. Nobody knows more about LeMarc than me. How could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I couldn’t tell you, then.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Really awful. Isabel thinks.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Then why aren’t you as good as Toulour? Rusty shrugs. A beat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 174 175 176 177 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 108.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I don’t want to arrest you, Robert. I really don’t. But I will if you make me. I will if you go for that egg. Rusty goes silent, looks out at the lights of the city.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: So many times, I waited. You can’t do that to a person.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Isabel--

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I have to go. Isabel gets up...walks away fast. She’s barely holding herself together. Rusty watches her go. Several seconds, then:

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Rusty carries a huge bouquet of flowers up the stairs to front door of his apartment with Isabel. It’s a perfect sunny day outside. He unlocks the door quietly and swings it open to see the apartment is bare. The furniture is still there. But nothing else. Nothing on the walls or the shelves. Isabel has clearly moved out. Rusty’s whole body reacts.... He slowly looks around him, if in a dream. His eye goes to the dining room table. Isabel’s engagement ring is there.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rusty is still watching Isabel, small now in the distance She turns the corner out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel pulls up in her car.  178 179 180 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Egg is being put into position. Isabel watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben is talking to Yen. Frank and Livingston get ready the background.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: You’re a photographer. Very exacting. You want things a certain way, but you never raise your voice. You’re uncompromising. Strong.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Reuben, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Oh, we understand each other. I’m mean, the actual words are gibberish to me, but I know what he means. There’s a tone, you know. We communicate. I’m sure he’d tell you the same thing. (to Yen) Am I right? Yen says something in Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and the Malloys are looking at Tess’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: I say we do a Joey Heatherton, 1971.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: It’s the wrong color. Turk looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Damn. There’s a knock at the door. They let Tess check on it. S looks out the keyhole; (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 180 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 110.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It’s TOPHER GRACE. Tess looks back to the group and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: (off) Hello? He knocks again. The group scrambles and hides. Tess opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Hey! I got your room number from McCormick, I hope you don’t mind. He walks in and hugs her. She looks terrified. Topher disengages and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: This is great. Do you have the adjoining room?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. I saw the rough cut of YOU ALWAYS, YOU NEVER. It’s so awesome. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: It was just like a dub of a lo-rez output, but I could totally see what you were doing. I think you might win again. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: It really actually looked like you were blind. How did you do that? What is it like, an on-set thing, or was it digital?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It was, uh... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 111.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: You can tell me, I won’t tell a soul. Because if you say it’s instinctual, I’m quitting right now. Seriously. The way you parted your hair? That was so connected. And that scene with the matches? And when you find out who your real grandmother is and run through the rain and find her on the porch and touch her face? Man, that was...you gotta tell Steven how much I loved it.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: So what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I'm, uh, getting ready to go out...

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: (laughs) I mean next. What movie are you doing next?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I...I’m having trouble deciding what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Is Danny working?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Danny...Danny is...Danny is...

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Is something wrong? Have you two...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: No, no...

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: No. we're absolutely fine, he’s just-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 180 181 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 112.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: I’ve got to stop asking people about their spouses, it’s like always a mistake--

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: No, really--

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Listen, I won’t say a word. Seriously. I’m rooting for you guys, you know that. This is your private business and I totally respect that. No more Danny questions from me.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Thank you. He’s fine. Danny’s fine. He’s working.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Hey, cool, whatever. That’s what I’ll say. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: So can I come look at that Egg with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben (dressed in a hip-hop outfit) and Linus (dressed l an agent) stand in front of some paparazzi. A crowd of museum employees also rubberneck.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: My name is Stuart Feldman, Worldwide Executive Senior Vice- President of Marketing, Corporate Senior Vice-President of Publicity and Corporate International Executive Worldwide President of Promotion for the Warner Brothers Motion Picture company. (indicating) My colleague, Grant Wells, who is responsible for Ms. Roberts itinerary, has graciously set aside time for Ms. Roberts to view the Coronation Egg privately.  182 183 184 185 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel, the Security Director, and Captain Giordano sit w four cops watching a bank of closed circuit screens.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I want to be on record as saying that you should have shut the entire museum down. Isabel keeps her eye on the tourists who circulate throug the other wings of the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Julia” arrives flanked by her “Nation of Islam” guards, Frank and Basher. The assembled employees clap and call h name. She waves as they take her picture. Topher throws his arm around Julia to make sure he gets i all the shots. The Museum Director comes up to greet “Julia”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel watches the security camera feeds.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: There! Right there! Isabel points at a screen showing the museum’s other entrance. Rusty nonchalantly slips into the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Julia” enters and walks up to the egg. Her entourage follows.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It’s so beautiful. My God. Topher looks at the egg--

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Kinda small. He turns away to look a cute girl on the museum staff. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 185 186 187 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 114.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Hi. BACK ON “JULIA” She leans in close to the egg.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m not going to set off any alarms?

dialogues.speaker: MUSEUM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: No. No. Get as close as you like. Reuben pops his head in between them.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: (obsequious ) Julia -- unless you have any objections -- Wen and his crew set up for the publicity stills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty ponders a painting like college student trying to impress his art history professor. Finally he moves on, i another gallery. PAN to REVEAL nine uniformed cops trailing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen ENTERS FRAME -- dressed like a pretentious grunge roc He whispers Chinese into a bullhorn. Theoretically he’s speaking to his crew (Danny, Saul, and Livingston in lame disguises) telling them where to set u the camera, lights, and flags. Each “crew member” carries an odd-looking oversized “ligh meter”. Upon closer examination we can see that each devi has a small TV screen on it -- which is tapped into the museum’s closed circuit system. The guys are carefully placing their flags and lights so as to block the view of egg from each of the eight cameras on the ceiling of the gallery. “Studio Execs,” Reuben and Linus go to “Julia.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 187 188 189 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 115.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe we could get you and Topher into some “You Always You Never” hats and t-shirts for the shoot--

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: That’s stupid.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: (instant reversal) So stupid! (turns to Linus as if it’s his idea) Idiot. (gingerly) Maybe we could put some posters in the background--

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I don’t think we want to be so obvious--

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I completely agree! (to Linus) Stop trying to turn this into some sort of stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel struts up to Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: This isn’t going to work.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen stands on two apple boxes to shoot photos of “Julia” Topher. “Julia” looks ridiculously stiff and keeps puttin her hands up to block her ears. Topher keeps shooting glances at Danny, who is moving aro flags and lights, ostensibly in accordance with Yen’s Chi language orders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 189 190 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 116.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Julia sees Topher’s expression -- he recognizes Danny fro somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks everybody. Thank you so much. She starts to walk out. Topher shrugs and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia and her entourage barrel down the hallway. Topher catches up.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Hey, J Ro, why the quick exit?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I...uh, I have to take some pills. Aspirin. I get headaches.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, with everything thing you've been going through I can see how you’d need something.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: They're just aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Right. I’ve never taken aspirin in my life, ever. Can you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: For me, it’s like a control thing.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Well, with aspirin...it’s very beneficial.

dialogues.speaker: TOPHER
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I’m sure. They are interrupted by the sound of PIERCING SIRENS and CLANGING BELLS -- all manner of alarms coming from the gallery containing the egg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 190 191 192 193 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 117.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tess rushes back to the gallery just in time to see polic officers pin Danny and his entire crew on the floor and against walls and start handcuffing them. She freezes. Can’t move.... Her bodyguards (Frank and Basher ) grab he and move her quickly out of the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three massive Ford Excursion SUV’s with diplomatic plates double park out front, completely blocking the flow of traffic on the narrow street. Eight FBI agents climb out of their behemoths and walk in like they own the place. The boss is a 55 year-old agent named MOLLY STARR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly Starr steps inside with her posse. She pulls out he badge and hangs it around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MOLLY STARR
dialogues.text: Who's in charge? Isabel and Captain Giordano look at her and her team with obvious trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (tentative) I am.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: (smelling trouble) She is. Molly gives a slight nod to one of her lackeys. He thrust an official-looking paper at Isabel. INT. “OBSERVATION "HALLWAY -- DAY 193 Molly swaggers down a hallway, followed by Isabel and Giordano. She stops at an observation window and looks through it to see Danny, who is handcuffed to a chair, awaiting interrogation. His expression is impassive. She moves on to the next window: Yen. Same impassive expression. She continues down the line, Reuben, Livingst and Saul. Each has the same impassive expression. Through the final window she sees Linus... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 193 194 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 118.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He’s nervously tapping his foot. Molly smiles sadisticall

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MOLLY STARR
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... I’11 start with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly sits face-to-face with Linus. Isabel and Captain Giordano stand in the corner and observe.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MOLLY STARR
dialogues.text: When people think of Italy they think of food, wine, the Renaissance. They don’t realize Italy has the scariest prisons in the civilized world. You know why? They’re all leftover from the Middle Ages. They’re worse than dirty; they’re damp. They’re like caves. Linus can’t look her in the eye. AGENT MOLLY STARR (cont'd) I’m the only hope you've got.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MOLLY STARR
dialogues.text: Testify against the others in the Benedict case.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MOLLY STARR
dialogues.text: Sure you can. You’ll get a year, maybe two. The Italian charges will be dropped. You and the others will be extradited to the US this afternoon. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MOLLY STARR
dialogues.text: Think about those prisons. Think about living there for twenty years, getting out when you’re fifty. What a catch you’l1l be.  195 196 197 198 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus is bundled into the back of the SUV. Agent Starr ge in next to him. She motions to the driver. They pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Starr’s SUV is followed by three other SUV's and escorted by two Rome Police cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus stares morosely at the headrest in front of him. A long, long beat...then he turns to Agent Starr:

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Did you tell Dad? Before “Agent Starr” answers the agent in the passenger s turns around. It’s Clint Eastwood.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Of course she did. We’re married, for God’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess waits. A key sounds in the door, and she is on her f She reaches Danny before he’s all the way in the room. Sh kisses him, then remembers she’s mad at him.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Because you’re not an actress. You wouldn’t have been so real. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 198 199 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 120.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to jail.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I’m not going to jail. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: So you don’t think I’m a good actress.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You're a terrible liar.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m a good liar.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Where did Benedict find you?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: He...

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: At your parent’s house.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: That was...okay, so I’m not a good liar. So what. You’re good enough for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcade of FBI SUV’s pulls through the security gat and drives toward a US government Gulfstream parked on th flight line. Isabel watches with Captain Giordino and Commander Andrio Linus, Saul, Yen, Livingston and Reuben get out of the SU all of them beaming. They hug Linus’s mom and dad and mou the steps to the plane. Then Rusty gets out, says goodbye everyone, and heads for Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: (eyes go wide) What the-- Oh my God! (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 121.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ISABEL (cont'd) (spins to Giordano) Call the tower! Don’t let that plane take off! Giordano stares blankly at her. But he doesn’t move. ISABEL (cont'd) Do something! Do you realize what’s happening?! Do you understand what’s going on?!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Yes, absolutely. Isabel blinks. It takes a second to hit her. Rusty approaches.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Guys. Get on there before they leave without you. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GIORDANO
dialogues.text: (speaking like an American) Hey, no problem. Good seeing you, man.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRIOTTI
dialogues.text: Take care. See you back home.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Scooter. Isabel is dumbstruck. 200 EXT. TOULOUR’S VILLA -- DAY 200 Toulour pulls up in a Ferrari. His butler gets the door f him.

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: How was Rome, air? Toulour answers by handing a small velvet bag to his butl (a bag just big enough to hold the coronation egg).

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Put this in the safe, would you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 201 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 122.

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: Of course, sir. Your guests are on the veranda.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Guests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel watches as the “US Government” Gulfstream containi all the members of Rusty’s crew that she arrested at the museum taxis down the runway and becomes airborne. She tu to Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: This will ruin me.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: No, it won’t. Not if you come to Zanzibar.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What is it with Zanzibar?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It’s where LeMarc is. Rusty points nearby at another private plane. The pilot h just opened the door and put the stairs down.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: That one’s ours. We can be there in three hours. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to meet him? He wants to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: You're asking me to turn my back on my whole life. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 201 202 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 123.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Would you miss it?

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: I’m aocop. That’s who I am.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You’re only a cop because your father was a thief.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Who died in a Russian jail.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: According to you mother.

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: It means you should meet LeMarc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toulour walks out to find Danny and Tess chomping on gour nuts and sipping his special reserve brandy.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
