dialogues.text: (to Danny) Let me guess, you decided you did want to give my lawyer a call. But you lost his card. Toulour holds out another card to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No, nothing like that. We just came to collect our money.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Not only did you fail, half of your crew got pinched! Your plan was not good. (to Tess) And you don’t look anything like Julia Roberts! I mean your... (motions ambiguously to her body) .«..and your... (another ambiguous motion) ...and your ears. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 202 203 204 205 206 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 124.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Toulour stops. Danny and Tess just look at him. Something about their demeanor is troubling. Namely, that they look completely untroubled.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You stole it on the way to Rome didn’t you? I stole a replica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A repeat of the shot of the SMALL, SECURE BOX being taken a truck. The truck moves out of the garage and on to the street as before. This time the shot continues over to a door on th side of the building. A YOUNG KID emerges with a backpack over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BACKPACK KID passes another guy, a NORMAL-LOOKING GUY who, after a beat, follows Backpack Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Backpack Kid, followed by Normal-Looking Guy, walk through the terminal and get in line. We swing over to se Normal Looking Guy #2 looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In motion. We start on the Backpack Kid, who is reading a book. The Backpack is beneath his legs. Next to him sits LINUS. Across from him is one of the Normal-Looking Guys. other Normal-Looking Guy is a row away, facing him. Linus looks at the door of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Is making his way through the door. He looks drunk.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Looks down at his copy of the French FHM.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 206 207 208 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 125.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gets close and closer to Linus and the Backpack Kid.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Puts his magazine away.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Is almost to Linus’s row, he stumbles a little, almost fa Then, with a loud WHOOSH the train goes completely dark. gone into a tunnel. We hear Saul’s voice CRY OUT. In a few seconds, the train exits the tunnel and the ligh come back on.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Has fallen into the lap of the BackPack kid. Linus and th Normal-Looking Guy try to help him up. He stumbles onward and collapses into a vacant seat.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: (in French) He’s completely drunk. The BackPack Kid nods his head. Linus goes back to his bo We drop down to see HIS BACKPACK also beneath his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus walks through the terminal, backpack over his shoul Suddenly he stops and kneels to tie his shoelace. Saul, seeing this and reacting, splits off into another direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linus and Saul approach the group.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What happened? Linus puts his BACKPACK down.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: We thought someone was following us.  209 210 211 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 126.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: But that means you knew what to steal before LeMarc proposed that I challenge you for it. That means... INT. RUSTY’S GARAGE -- DAY 210 The image from the beginning of the film, with Rusty watc the boiling cask. He’s talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Gaspar, it’s Rusty. How are you? And this time we see what be is working on: A PERFECT REPLICA OF THE CORONATION EGG. In the warehouse in NYC, we see Danny and Rusty “arguing” but from a different angle. They are smiling as they yell

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I’M TELLING YOU IT’S A DEATH

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: LeMarc told you. Of course. He looks deflated. It’s probably just occurring to him th he’s never lost before. He sits down.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: To teach me. He is silent. Tess indicates to Danny that they should leave. Danny nod and they rise. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 211 212 213 214 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 127.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Well, we’1ll be in touch to make all the arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: No. Don’t go. Please. Toulour gets up.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: You are my guests. I will celebrate your victory. Besides, you may have noticed, I don’t like to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are toasting champagne.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: I am feeling more French by the minute. To my first depression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul and Basher ride to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: So I think if you really analyze it, you can see that it’s inevitable. It’s time for us to evolve, en masse. I have to help bring that about whatever way I can, you know. Otherwise, the trajectory is fixed. You know what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Mmm. Yes. But I’m through evolving, I think. It’s too tiring. I feel pretty evolved. You know, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Yen buy magazines. Yen has a copy of an ITALIAN TABLOID. The headline screams CO-STAR SAYS JULIA MARRIAGE TROUBLE. A sub-headline reads HER ADDICTION TO PAINKILLER RIPPING THEM APART.  215 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In First Class. Basher and Saul tip champagne glasses. Virgil, Turk, and Linus all crack open copies of their st to read.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: I’ve got an idea for another Dominique story.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: Can we finish this one first?

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Just let me tell it to you.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: It’s like three sentences.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGIL
dialogues.text: I’m serious; you’re asking too much. Virgil puts on his headset. Turk leans over to Linus and begins to speak. Linus, reading, holds his finger up. Yen reads a magazine. Reuben glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: May I look at that when you’re through with it? Yen says something. It would seem he is okay with that. Livingston speaks into his VOICE RECORDER.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: (trying to be dispassionate) All in all, it was depressingly familiar. The forced camaraderie, the hollow smiles. Scared to take a moment's reflection. Scared to imagine a different life. We behaved like boys. (beat, he chokes) But... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 215 “Clowns Can’t Sleep”

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He begins to weep, quietly, but very quickly regains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: LIVINGSTON
dialogues.text: I’m Livingston Dell. Thanks for listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess and Danny enjoy the sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: When do you want to go back?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Feel like traveling?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Toulour enters with THE LAST BEAUTIFUL WOMAN in tow.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: Tess. Danny. This is Monica Bellucci. And indeed it is.

dialogues.speaker: MONICA
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: TOULOUR
dialogues.text: We're thinking of taking a trip to the states. Take a look around. We'd love to meet some of your friends while we're there. Actually, one friend in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the Gulfstream jet.  218 219 220 221 “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel looks out the window. Rusty watches her, She looks over at him, then back out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunning. Classic. Rusty and Isabel pull up. He takes her hand and leads her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusty and Isabel walk through the house.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: There he is. Rusty indicates the back porch. A figure sits in a lounge chair, reading a book. This is LEMARC. RUSTY (cont'd) Gaspar!

dialogues.speaker: ISABEL
dialogues.text: Gaspar? That was my fa-- Isabel looks to the porch just as LE MARC, her father, tu to face her. She goes to him and they embrace. ISABEL (cont'd) Daddy. LeMarc looks to Rusty. Rusty salutes, makes a drinking gesture and heads for the kitchen. The sound of a jet takes us to

dialogues.speaker: A GLOBE 221
dialogues.text: As we rotate from Toulour’s villa to LAS VEGAS, NEVADA

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 131.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the Bellagio hotel. cut TO

dialogues.speaker: A RECEIPT 223
dialogues.text: For a wire transfer of $ 191,507,067.37 into the account TB ENTERPRISES. Description: “Repayment of personal loan”

dialogues.speaker: TERRY BENEDICT 224
dialogues.text: Staring at this receipt. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Is opposite him. They are both being served for lunch by JACKETED WAITER, whose face is continually obscured.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: That’s the exact figure, I’m pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: So we're clean?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: You want it in writing?

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: I’1l take your word.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: You’re clean.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: These grudges, they’re awful. Nobody wine.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: As soon as someone retaliates, the situation is out of control. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Clowns Can’t Sleep” 132.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: This way, there’s no need for retaliation. Why would there be?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: There’s plenty for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: More than plenty. It’s just a matter of sharing.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Sharing is good.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: It is. Waiter? Can I get sparkling water? It’s good for my acid reflux.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (off) Of course. The waiter turns toward the bar and we see now that he is FRANCOIS TOULOUR. He’s wearing a STRIPED TULIP in his WAITER’S JACKET.
